translated: The Sutra of the Initial Supreme Dharma Door of Distinguishing Dependent Origination, Fascicle 2
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang of the Great Tang Dynasty on Imperial Order
Furthermore, World-Honored One! As explained elsewhere, there are four kinds of conditions, namely causal conditions,
immediately preceding conditions, object-conditions, and dominant conditions.
World-Honored One!
Now, based on which conditions do you say that ignorance conditions formations, and based on which conditions do you say that from birth old age and death arise in sequence?
The World-Honored One said:

I proclaim the four kinds of conditions in general terms based on the general characteristics of formations. In this meaning, I only say that ignorance conditions formations based on the dominant condition, and in sequence up to birth conditioning old age and death based on the dominant condition.
This dominant condition is of two kinds: distant and proximate.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is this dominant condition distant?
How is it proximate?
The World-Honored One said:
When improper attention has not yet arisen, the latent tendency of ignorance can act as a remote dominant condition for the formations.
Once it has arisen, it then acts as a proximate dominant condition.

The formations that are attracted by improper attention, which are associated with and co-existent with the six consciousnesses, when they have not yet arisen, can act as a remote dominant condition for consciousness;
once they have arisen, they can act as a proximate dominant condition for consciousness.
When one has not yet died, consciousness acts as a remote dominant condition for name-and-form;
once one has died, consciousness acts as a proximate dominant condition for name-and-form.
Just as consciousness is in relation to name-and-form, so is the attracted name-and-form in relation to the born name-and-form.
Just as name-and-form is in relation to name-and-form, so is the six sense bases in relation to the six sense bases, contact in relation to contact, and feeling in relation to feeling.
It is like the relationship between ignorance and the various karmic formations, between ignorance and craving, between craving and grasping, and between grasping and becoming.
It is like the relationship between consciousness and name-and-form, between name-and-form and so forth, and between becoming and birth.
When in the womb, as an infant, child, or youth, birth is a distant dominant condition for old age and death;
When the faculties mature and life is about to end, it should be known that it becomes a proximate dominant condition.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
In the Dharma Door Sutra, it is said that craving is the cause of karma. What is the hidden meaning of this?
The World-Honored One said:
Karmic activities that are appropriated use craving as their cause. This is the hidden meaning explained here.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How should one understand the three distinct meanings of cause, condition, and basis?
The World-Honored One said:
The meaning of cause is that which can project the seeds of future births;ğŸ”½The meaning of condition is that which, by providing support and sustenance, enables arising;
The meaning of basis is that which, after death, guides and leads to the next birth.
One should understand the distinctions among these three meanings.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is the meaning of the term 'dependent origination'?
The World-Honored One said:
The meaning of dependent origination is that each of these factors arises in continuity due to the convergence of its own conditions without deficiency.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
Is there only the continuity of this birth?
Or are there other dependent originations?
The World-Honored One said:
I explain dependent origination in eight ways:

First, it is said that there is a dependent arising of worldly realms that are experienced, referring to the arising of eye consciousness in dependence on the eye and form. The combination of these three things constitutes contact, and contact serves as a condition for feeling. This is explained in detail.
Second, it is said that there is a dependent arising of sustenance, referring to the nourishment and growth of the faculties and great elements in dependence on the four kinds of food.

Third, it is said that there is a dependent arising of the causes of nourishment, referring to the generation of sprouts and so forth in dependence on seeking grains, fields, seeds, and water conditions.

Fourth, it is said that there is a dependent arising of the continuity of all bodily existences, referring to the generation of all that is attracted and produced by means of the various discriminations that attract and produce.

Fifth, it is said that there is a dependent arising of the support of all bodily existences, referring to the establishment and destruction of the various worlds by means of various causes and conditions.

Sixth, it is said that there is a dependent arising of the distinctions of all bodily existences, referring to the establishment of the distinctions of the three evil destinies and the destinies of humans and gods by means of unwholesome, wholesome, and contaminated actions.

Seventh, it explains the pure dependent arising, which means that based on the sounds of others and based on one's own inner proper contemplation, one gives rise to right views that can extinguish ignorance. Because ignorance is extinguished, the various practices are extinguished. Explaining extensively up to, because of the extinction of birth, old age and death are extinguished.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
If ignorance and so forth sequentially serve as conditions to give rise to various practices and so forth, is it then the case that they are extinguished in this very sequence?
The Buddha said:
It is not so.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is the reason for explaining their extinction in sequence?
The World-Honored One said:

In order to show that due to the non-arising function of the previous factors, it causes the later factors to obtain the dharma of non-arising, therefore they are explained in sequence. However, it is not that the arising and extinguishing dharmas do not have a sequential transformation.

Eighth, it is said that there is a self-mastery dependent origination, namely, by taking the cultivation of meditative absorption as a condition, those who cultivate concentration, according to their wishes, all accomplish this and never differ.
These are called the eight aspects of dependent origination that I have briefly explained.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
As the Buddha has said, birth is due to karma and transformation is due to craving.
Based on what hidden meaning was this said?
The World-Honored One said:

Ignorance as a condition, first in the various existences, creates and increases various meritorious actions, non-meritorious actions, and immovable actions, and produces and accepts the seeds of various bodies.
In this existence, if craving has not yet been eliminated, due to this craving it can cause actions, etc., to transform into existence.
Existence gives rise to the power of the later existence body. This power is not apart from craving.
Based on this hidden meaning, it is said that birth is due to karma and transformation is due to craving.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
If the World-Honored One says that craving is the cause of continuation, why is it only said that grasping is the condition for existence, and not that craving is the condition for existence?
The World-Honored One said:
If apart from grasping, craving cannot be the condition for transforming non-meritorious actions, etc., into the link of existence and producing the evil destinies.

Moreover, if apart from grasping, the craving for non-existence cannot be the condition for transforming meritorious and immovable actions into the link of existence and producing the good destinies in the indeterminate and determined realms.
Therefore, it is not only craving that is the condition for existence, but that link of existence definitely has grasping as its condition.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
As the MahÄnidÄna-sÅ«tra says:
'You, Ä€nanda!
If there were no birth among the various kinds of sentient beings, there would be no such and such kinds of birth;
If there were no birth at all, then birth would not be a condition for old age and death.
Based on what hidden meaning did you say this?
The World-Honored One said:
Based on the two hidden meanings of what is brought forth and what is born, I said this.
Also, based on the two hidden meanings of the distant dominant condition for old age and death and the proximate dominant condition for old age and death, I said this.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
You previously gave a brief explanation of the meaning of dependent origination, but you have not yet explained the meaning of dependent origination. How should we understand it?
The World-Honored One said:
The meaning of dependent origination can be summarized in eleven ways. You should understand it as follows:

It means the meaning of no creator is the meaning of dependent origination, the meaning of arising from causes is the meaning of dependent origination, the meaning of being apart from sentient beings is the meaning of dependent origination, the meaning of arising in dependence on others is the meaning of dependent origination, the meaning of no activity is the meaning of dependent origination, the meaning of the nature being impermanent is the meaning of dependent origination, the meaning of momentary cessation is the meaning of dependent origination, the meaning of the continuity of cause and effect without interruption is the meaning of dependent origination, the meaning of the distinction of various kinds of causes and effects is the meaning of dependent origination, the meaning of the mutual conformity of causes and effects is the meaning of dependent origination, and the meaning of the certainty and non-confusion of causes and effects is the meaning of dependent origination.
Thus, one should understand the concise meaning of dependent origination.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
As it is said in other sÅ«tras, dependent origination is profound.
How should one understand the profound characteristics of dependent origination in this way?
The World-Honored One said:
One should understand the five profound aspects of dependent origination based on the concise meaning of the eleven aspects of dependent origination.
What are the five?
First, the profundity of causes; second, the profundity of characteristics; third, the profundity of arising; fourth, the profundity of distinctions; fifth, the profundity of cyclic existence.
It should be known that the profound characteristics of dependent origination are also of five kinds.
What are the five?

Namely, the profundity of characteristics, the profundity of the causal factors that give rise to [dependent origination], the profundity of the causal factors that arise [from dependent origination], the profundity of distinctions, and the profundity of antidotes.
It should be known that dependent origination also has five kinds of profound characteristics.
What are the five?
Namely, the profundity of inclusion, the profundity of the forward sequence, the profundity of the reverse sequence, the profundity of grasping, and the profundity of the objects [of consciousness].
This is called the excellence of the arising of ignorance.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is the transformation and difference of ignorance excellent?
The World-Honored One said:
In brief, there are four kinds of transformation and difference of ignorance.
What are the four?

First, the transformation of latent tendencies is ignorance; second, the transformation of entanglements is ignorance; third, the transformation of association is ignorance; fourth, the transformation of non-commonality is ignorance.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
Who has what kind of transformation of ignorance, and is it said that ignorance is the condition for the arising of karmic formations?
The World-Honored One said:

The four kinds of transformation of ignorance, which are brought about by improper mental activity of ordinary beings in the external realm, give rise to meritorious, non-meritorious, and immovable karmic formations based on this as a condition.

Thus, all the wholesome minds associated with meritorious and immovable karmic formations of ordinary beings in the external realm are the outflow of what is brought about by improper mental activity.

If ordinary beings in the internal realm are negligent, they give rise to karmic formations based on all the remaining ignorance, except for one kind of non-common ignorance, which brings about negligence as a condition.

If ordinary beings who are not heedless and diligently study, as well as noble ones in training, give rise to false thoughts due to the three kinds of ignorance, this becomes the condition for demerit. However, this demerit cannot serve as a condition to attract the three evil destinies.
Therefore, I do not say that demerit is conditioned by ignorance.
Thus, the so-called unique ignorance is not yet eliminated by ordinary beings who are not heedless but who study, and it should be known that it is permanently eliminated by noble ones in training.

Moreover, ordinary beings who are not heedless, if they create meritorious or immovable actions, those are attracted by the wholesome mind associated with correct attention to the true Dharma, because they are attracted by liberation, rely on liberation, and dedicate themselves to liberation. Although they experience excellent rebirth in the good destinies, ignorance does not act as the dominant condition, but it can create the four kinds of ignorance.

The noble ones who are still learning have already permanently eliminated the non-shared ignorance, so they do not create new karma. As for past karma, due to the power of the latent afflictions it has not yet been permanently eliminated. They temporarily experience it but then spit it out. In this way, the ignorance that conditions formations gradually ceases with each rebirth and no longer increases.
Based on this principle, one should understand that the learners within the inner Dharma do not create formations based on ignorance.

Therefore, I only speak of the forward progression of dependent arising based on external phenomena and ordinary beings, which is the most complete. It is not based on those within the inner Dharma. This is called the superiority of the transformation of ignorance.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is the superiority of the mistaken practices of ignorance?
The World-Honored One said:
Those four kinds of ignorance can all give rise to the two kinds of mistaken practices of superimposition and denial regarding the truths. He further said:
World-Honored One!
What are called the two kinds of mistaken practices of superimposition and denial?
The World-Honored One said:

Due to the four inversions, namely, seeing what is not the Dharma as the Dharma, or seeing what is the Dharma as not the Dharma, or seeing what is not the means to the path of rebirth in the heavens and liberation as the means, or seeing what is the means as not the means - this is called the superior practice of increasing;
all those who slander and have all kinds of wrong views are called the superior practice of diminishing.
This is called the superiority of the wrong practice of ignorance.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is the superiority of the characteristics of ignorance?
The World-Honored One said:
You should know that ignorance has two kinds of characteristics:
First, the superiority of the subtle specific characteristic; second, the superiority of the common characteristic that pervades all lovable, unlovable, and neutral objects.
Why is this so?
Even the manifest ignorance is still subtle, difficult to know and understand, let alone the latent ignorance;

The associated ignorance is still subtle and difficult to know and understand, let alone the uncommon ignorance that exists, pervading all lovable, unlovable, and neutral objects, obscuring the true characteristics and manifesting false characteristics, while co-arising with the common characteristics.
Other afflictions do not have such characteristics. Therefore, it is superior.
The common afflictions such as the view of self also rely on ignorance to arise. This is called the superiority of the characteristics of ignorance.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is the superior function of ignorance?
The World-Honored One said:
You should know that ignorance generally has two kinds of functions:
First, ignorance universally creates the basis for all cyclic existence; second, ignorance universally creates the obstacles for all cessation.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is called 'all cyclic existence'?
The World-Honored One said:
If it is this place that turns, this matter that turns, or this way that turns, I will explain it as all turning.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is the place that turns?
The World-Honored One said:
In the three times, the place is turned by my discrimination.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is the matter that turns?
The World-Honored One said:
The inner and outer six sense bases are grasped and clung to by me.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How does it turn?
The World-Honored One said:
The continuity of the ripening of karma turns by my discrimination and wrong discrimination.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is called the cessation of all?
The World-Honored One said:
The cessation of all is roughly of four kinds:

First, the basis of tranquility, second, the object of tranquility, third, the mental orientation of tranquility, and fourth, the accomplishment of the fruit of tranquility. These are called the distinctive activity of ignorance.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is the distinctive obstruction of ignorance?
The World-Honored One said:
One should know that ignorance obstructs the supreme Dharma and the extensive Dharma.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How does ignorance obstruct the supreme Dharma?
The World-Honored One said:

As for the supreme Dharma, it is able to gather the five faculties and cause them to unite, namely the faculty of wisdom. The obstruction of this is precisely ignorance. Therefore, it is called the obstruction of the supreme Dharma.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How does ignorance obstruct the extensive Dharma?
The World-Honored One said:

As for the extensive dharmas, the knowledge that is heard, the knowledge that is contemplated, and the knowledge that is cultivated, the obstruction of these is precisely ignorance. Therefore, it is called the obstruction of extensive dharmas.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
As it is said, the absence of knowledge is called ignorance. Is this only the absence of knowledge called ignorance?
The World-Honored One said:
It is not only the absence of knowledge called ignorance.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
If the absence of knowledge is called ignorance, what fault is there in this?
The World-Honored One said:
If so, ignorance should not be able to establish a definite essence.
Why is it so?
In the essence of knowledge that is heard, there is no knowledge that is contemplated;
in the essence of knowledge that is contemplated, there is no knowledge that is cultivated;
in the essence of all worldly knowledge that is cultivated, there is no knowledge that is cultivated in all supramundane realms;
Above the supramundane wisdom of the learner, there is no wisdom of the post-learner;
Above the wisdom of the Å›rÄvaka post-learner, there is no wisdom of the TathÄgata and so forth.
If this is so, then it should be wisdom and also not wisdom. In this way, ignorance should not be established as having a definite essence.

Moreover, I have said that non-delusion exists among the three roots of goodness. It should only be the absence of delusion called non-delusion, but the absence of delusion is not called non-delusion. Therefore, the absence of illumination is not called ignorance. There is a separate mental factor that does not know reality called ignorance.

There is a separate mental factor that illuminates reality called wisdom. Moreover, if only the absence of illumination is called ignorance, then there should not be these eleven kinds of excellence of all ignorance.
Therefore, you should know that it is not only the absence of illumination called ignorance. This is called the excellence of obstruction of ignorance.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is the excellence of the bonds of ignorance?
The World-Honored One said:

Up to the peak of existence, sentient beings of the three realms have all the ignorance, latent tendencies, and bonds regarding the truths that have not been cut off or reduced. Because of this, sentient beings are said to be fully bound.

Moreover, this ignorance, regarding the causes and effects of good and evil destinies, is of the lowest grade for formless sentient beings, of the middle grade for form realm sentient beings, and of the highest grade for desire realm sentient beings. In this way, one accomplishes the three grades of ignorance.
All classes of sentient beings will have the three grades of bonds in accordance with the Dharma.
This refers to ordinary beings. If the noble ones gradually permanently cut them off, if they have the middle and lower grades, they may or may not have the upper and middle grades.

Moreover, although arhats have exhausted all defilements and are free from the afflictive hindrances, one should know that they are still bound by the ignorance that is included in the cognitive hindrances. One should know that such ignorance has followed sentient beings for an extremely long time, except for the Buddhas, who are all still bound by it.
This is called the superiority of the bondage of ignorance.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is the superiority of the antidotes to ignorance?
The World-Honored One said:
There are two kinds of wondrous cognition that counteract ignorance.
What are the two?
The first is the wondrous cognition that relies on the sounds of others or does not rely on them, and is of a limited and measurable Dharma realm;
The second is the wondrous cognition that relies on the sounds of others, and is of an unlimited and immeasurable Dharma realm.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is the object of the wondrous cognition of a limited and measurable Dharma realm?
What are its characteristics?
What is its function?
The World-Honored One said:

The subtle and limited dharma realm's wondrous wisdom, taking the four noble truths and sixteen aspects as its object, creates the activities of afflictions such as ignorance, giving rise to all the activities of defilement and bondage.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How should one understand the characteristics of the suffering of birth?
The World-Honored One said:
It is because it is the basis for the suffering of internal conditions, the basis for the suffering of external conditions, and the basis for the suffering of both conditions.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What are the characteristics of the suffering of internal conditions?
The World-Honored One said:
Namely, the suffering of illness, the suffering of aging, and the suffering of death.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What are the characteristics of the suffering of external conditions?
The World-Honored One said:
The suffering of being united with what is unloved, separated from what is loved, and not obtaining what is sought.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What are the characteristics of the suffering of both conditions?
The World-Honored One said:
In brief, it refers to the five aggregates subject to clinging and suffering.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is craving?
The World-Honored One said:
It is the greed for one's present body.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What are the characteristics of craving for future existence?
The World-Honored One said:
It is the desire for one's future body.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is craving accompanied by joy and greed?
The World-Honored One said:
It is deeply indulging in and attaching to the present objects of the six senses that one has obtained and possesses.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is called 'craving for various pleasures'?
The World-Honored One said:
It is the various pursuits for the possessions and objects of the six senses that one has not yet obtained and does not possess.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is this craving completely eliminated without remainder?
The World-Honored One said:

Because the afflictions eliminated through the path of seeing and cultivation are eliminated, because the lower and upper bonds are eliminated, because they are ultimately eliminated, because the craving for future suffering is eliminated, and because the craving for present suffering is eliminated, this is called the complete and permanent elimination of this craving without remainder.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is it to be abandoned?
The World-Honored One said:
Because the afflictions eliminated through the path of seeing are eliminated.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is it to be vomited out?
The World-Honored One said:
Because the afflictions eliminated through the path of cultivation are eliminated.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is it to be completely exhausted?
The World-Honored One said:
Because the lower bonds are permanently eliminated.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is it to be far removed?
The World-Honored One said:
Because the upper fetters have been permanently severed.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is it permanently extinguished?
The World-Honored One said:
Because it is ultimately severed.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is it tranquil?
The World-Honored One said:
Because the love for future suffering fruits is permanently severed.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is it submerged?
The World-Honored One said:
Because the love for present suffering fruits is permanently severed.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is right view?
The World-Honored One said:

It refers to the wisdom of preparatory effort before realization, the wisdom of right realization, and the wisdom obtained after realization, transcending the wrong practices of understanding and teaching in the knowledge of the sages.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is right thought?
The World-Honored One said:
It means having already attained the purity of faith in the Three Jewels as the basis, contemplating and recollecting their merits, and transcending the refuge in non-Buddhist teachers and others.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is right speech?
The World-Honored One said:

It means being included in the uncontaminated precepts loved by the noble ones, turning together with the uncontaminated attention, and being able to correctly avoid the four verbal actions, transcending all perilous and evil destinies.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is right action?
The World-Honored One said:

It means being included in the uncontaminated precepts loved by the noble ones, turning together with the uncontaminated attention, and being able to correctly avoid the three bodily actions, transcending all perilous and evil destinies.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is right livelihood?
The World-Honored One said:

It refers to the precepts loved by the noble ones, which are included in the uncontaminated, and which occur simultaneously with uncontaminated attention. Regarding the pursuit of wrong livelihood, it is the correct avoidance of bodily and verbal actions, transcending all perilous and evil destinies.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is right effort?
The World-Honored One said:
Based on the desire and joy for the higher liberation, one generates diligent effort to distance oneself from hindrances and perfect the antidotes.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is right mindfulness?
The World-Honored One said:

The yogis who diligently cultivate tranquility and insight, based on the three characteristics, from time to time clearly and distinctly record in their minds the three kinds of characteristics and the objects of practice accompanied by heedfulness, transcending the path of practice of distancing and seclusion.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is right concentration?
The World-Honored One said:

It is said that by means of these seven kinds of concentration equipment, the one-pointedness of mind is assisted and adorned, and is able to serve as the basis for the progress of these seven factors, as well as serving as the basis for the generation of superior merits.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
All the factors of enlightenment such as the four establishments of mindfulness are included in the noble path. Why is it that only the eightfold noble path is considered to be the truth of the path?
The World-Honored One said:
It is said that these eight factors of the noble path universally include all the factors of enlightenment.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
Regarding the truth of suffering, there are four aspects. Why is the first called the aspect of impermanence?
It is said that it is the correct contemplation of the nature of arising and ceasing in regard to the truth of suffering.
Why is the second called the aspect of suffering?
It means using the nature of arising and ceasing with regard to the truth of suffering as a basis, and correctly contemplating the characteristics of being followed by the three kinds of suffering.
What is meant by the third characteristic of emptiness?
It means correctly contemplating the characteristics of being apart from the nature of a real self with regard to the truth of suffering.
What is meant by the fourth characteristic of no-self?
It means correctly contemplating the characteristics of the nature of non-self with regard to the truth of suffering.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
With regard to the truth of the origin [of suffering], there are four characteristics. What is meant by the first characteristic of cause?
It means correctly contemplating the characteristics of craving, which is the cause for planting the seeds of suffering.
What is meant by the second characteristic of accumulation?
It means correctly contemplating the characteristics of craving, which is the cause for continuation.
What is meant by the third characteristic of arising?
It means correctly contemplating the characteristics of craving, which is the cause for the arising of differences in the five destinies.
What is the fourth called the aspect of conditions?
It means correctly contemplating the aspect of conditions in craving, which is the cause of other conditions that give rise to [afflictions].
Again, he said:
World-Honored One!
There are four aspects of the truth of cessation. What is the first called the aspect of cessation?
It means correctly contemplating the aspect of cessation in the complete severance of afflictions.
What is the second called the aspect of tranquility?
It means correctly contemplating the aspect of tranquility in the complete severance of various sufferings.
What is the third called the aspect of excellence?
It means correctly contemplating the aspect of the nature of purity, peace, and bliss in the complete severance of wrongdoing.
What is the fourth called the aspect of separation?
It means correctly contemplating the aspect of the nature of permanence in the complete severance of [samsaric] existence.
Again, he said:
World-Honored One!
There are four aspects of the truth of the path. What is the first called the aspect of the path?
It refers to the nature of non-delusion that is in accord with the object in the noble path, and the correct observation of the aspects of practice.
Why is the second called the aspect of suchness?
It refers to the nature of being forever free from the world and free from defilements in the noble path, and the correct observation of the aspects of practice.
Why is the third called the aspect of practice?
It refers to the nature of being traversed by the sages of the past and the sages of the future in the noble path, and the correct observation of the aspects of practice.
Why is the fourth called the aspect of the practice of practice?
It refers to the correct observation of the aspects of practice in the nature that is unsurpassed in the noble path.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
Why are there only four noble truths?
The World-Honored One said:
These four truths comprehensively include all the natures of defiled and pure causes and effects.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
Why are the four truths taught in this sequence?
The World-Honored One said:
It is because in the world, diseases, causes of diseases, cessation of diseases, and good medicines are similar.
Again, he said:
World-Honored One!
When entering the path of seeing, is there a sudden realization of these four truths?
Or is there a gradual realization?
The World-Honored One said:
There is a separate principle called sudden realization, and there is a separate principle called gradual realization.
What is the separate principle called sudden realization?

It refers to personally realizing the holy wisdom of the true meaning. In the realm of true wisdom, it is the meaning of non-establishment, and because of the general characteristics, it is called sudden realization.
What is the separate principle called gradual realization?

It refers to the wisdom of beginners and the wisdom of subsequent attainment, which observes the characteristics of self and the characteristics of cause and effect. Because of the characteristics of practice and the characteristics of distinctions, it is called gradual realization.
Again, he said:
World-Honored One!
If there are these four noble truths, why did the World-Honored One also speak of two truths, namely the conventional truth and the ultimate truth?
The World-Honored One said:
In these four noble truths, if it is the realm of the knowledge of abiding in the Dharma, it is called the conventional truth.
If it is the realm of the supreme meaning knowledge realized within oneself, and the realm of the knowledge of non-establishment, it is called the ultimate truth.
